poem:
Title: "Of Tories, Bills, and Distant Shores"

Steeping in the morning's news,
a tussle over a distant land's blues.
Swift fingers of Boris fight the dawn,
tweeting against a bill with brawn.

Oh, Rwanda, cast in legal light,
mused upon in London's night.
Such prattle in the world's vast scroll,
as if each man's word might take its toll.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
